text: Smith Clark was a lawyer and legislator in 19th-century Connecticut. Clark was born in , and went on to graduate from Yale College in 1817. A lifelong lawyer in his home town of Haddam, Connecticut, Clark also served as a probate court judge. Clark was a representative from Haddam in the Connecticut General Assembly for a single term. In January 1827, Clark took the seat of George W. Smith and served alongside Simon Shailor through that June. Clark's seat was picked up by Charles Arnold the following February. On September 12, 1876, Clark died at the age of 84; he was survived by one son. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1790s births Category:1876 deaths Category:Connecticut lawyers Category:members of the Connecticut General Assembly Category:people from Haddam, Connecticut Category:Yale College alumni
title: Smith Clark
